text: "Be My Mistake" is a song by British indie rock band, The 1975. The track is the sixth song on their third studio album, A Brief Inquiry into Online Relationships. Despite not being an official single from the album, it charted on the New Zealand and U.S. rock charts. == Meaning == In an November 2018 interview with Pitchfork, lead singer Matty Healy described "Be My Mistake" as a song about guilt. Healy further explained "It’s about when you are a young person and you struggle sometimes to figure out what you really want. And sometimes, like a lot of things, it requires you to make a mistake before you actually understand what you have." Healy described Nick Drake as an influence for the song. == Critical reception == Writing for PopBuzz, Katie Louise Smith called "Be My Mistake" "is almost like an even sadder sequel to 'Somebody Else' and it will one hundred percent destroy you emotionally". == Charting == {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2018–19) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- |- |} == References == == External links == * Official Acoustic Video Category:2018 songs Category:The 1975 songs Category:Songs written by Matthew Healy Category:Folk rock songs
